name: Frasers Residence Shanghai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed from 5.Jun to 12.Jun at 20th floor and this residence is very pleasant, the location is the best, very safety, rooms are pleasant and very clean. Free internet at room, two bottles of water free every day at room, lobby with coffee and newspapers for free. The staff was very nice and helpful. All of ours needs was quickly satisfied. It's a good place to stay near to Dashijie subway station and near of People' s Square, Xintiandi, Dongtai Rd.Antique Marquet is just 2 min walking from hotel. We paid 1025 yuan per night with 1 breakfast included, that we thinks that's a bit expensive for China, but is a good option.
reviews.title: Good location and staff

reviews.text: When I read some of the bad reviews of the Fraser Residence, I think that the travelers did not really realize what they're booking. This is a great value for a hotel in a central (and nice) part of Shanghai with more room than the average city hotel.
reviews.title: Luxury Serviced Apartments in Great Location

reviews.text: I stayed in a 2-bedroom suite with my husband and mom and dad for 4 nights visiting family in Shanghai. Our suite at the Fraser Residence had a full kitchen, laundry facility in the room, spacious living and dining room that allowed us to entertain visitors. It was like having your own luxury condo in the middle of one of the nicest parts of Shanghai (Louis Vuitton, Tiffany's, Gucci, Hermes stores all within walking distance).
reviews.title: Great location and value for money

reviews.text: What Fraser Residence is not is a full service hotel. There is a pool and a tennis court, but nothing super luxurious like the Ritz Carlton. Front desk was very helpful, nut there are no extended concierge services. The rooms are comfortably furnished (and king beds are plush) but again, not decorated to the nines.
reviews.title: Sub standard 4* serviced accomodation

reviews.text: The complimentary breakfast at Element Fresh cafe offers several choices of both western and Chinese style food, and is much better than most other hotels' buffet options. There is also a "snack food street" just across Xizang Rd that offers more local authentic cuisine if you're the adventurous foodie type.
reviews.title: Poor attitude of front desk staff, and disgraceful guest service

reviews.text: We stayed at Fraser Residence Shanghai from January 6th to 9th for 4 days. The receiption staff were very friendy, professonal, and extented us every courtesy while we stayed in Shanghai. The staff arranged every convinience for us the moment we entered the lobby, even purchasing travel arrangements for a one day Bullet Train trip, hiring taxis with accurate destination information, and recommending points of interests to see in downtown. What an affordable location to walk from to get to most of Shanghai's Shopping districts! We were pleasantly surprised at how relaxing our room was,
reviews.title: Home Away From Home

reviews.text: and how delicious and healthful the 6th floor dining restaurant was, as well.
reviews.title: Great location and helpful staff

reviews.text: We have stayed in Shanghai 6 times, and this was by far the most enjoyable experience! We highly recommend this service apartment for the seasoned traveller as well as the first time visitor to Shanghai.
reviews.title: Good Choice for Serviced Apartment near XinTianDi

reviews.text: We had one night at the New Harbour Hotel and the next day switched here. Fraser was perfect for us. The rooms were a bit small, but new and clean. We had a 2 bedroom with washer/dryer and full kitchen. Only negative was one bath for a family of 5, but we managed. They could do a bit better with the daily housekeeping (the trash cans are small and they did not empty them), but otherwise great place. The staff was so helpful and very patient with my 3 young boys. Breakfast for 2 was included at Element Fresh and we just bought extra. The location was great-we could walk everywhere! I highly recommend this place. Good business center and small gym, but had treadmills, weights, etc. Pool was a short walk located at the spa across the yard. Nice pool, but not great for kids since it was in the spa; will say the spa staff was patient with us.
reviews.title: Much better than the earlier reviews indicate

reviews.text: I stayed here for a month during the summer, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a comfortable service apartment near the XinTianDi area. The service apartment is well located - about a 10mins walk to XinTianDi, 2 mins to HuaiHai Road, and the Times Square shopping mall where there is a good supermarket. Fraser Residence also is home to a trendy restaurant, Fat Olive, managed by local celebrity chef David Laris, and Element Fresh, a reliable salad/ sandwich chain popular with Shanghai expats. I had some problems with housekeeping but after a few calls to the front desk, those issues were resolved. Front desk is very helpful in general. Pool is dismal. I paid about RMB 600/ night for a one-bedroom for the duration of my stay.
reviews.title: great location to experience local living

reviews.text: Nice, clean apartment style facility.Free internet. Courteous staff all around. Element Fresh Restaurant provided decent breakfast; great juice bar.
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.text: Location also good for walking, subway.
reviews.title: Very LOUD! - under construction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a one-bed room apartment for 4 nights in Sep.
reviews.title: Great location, average room

reviews.text: Location - the best feature of this hotel. The nearby Times Square (2 mins walk) has a supermarket, a foreign language book store (Charterhouse) which offers a decent range of English books, some upmarket shops (Gucci etc) and Zara.
reviews.title: Good hotel, nothing special.

reviews.text: Room: our aparment was facing Shouning Road and was quiet. Decor is of average standard and the bathroom could have been cleaner. Tips for aircon: put the nightmode on when you go to sleep, otherwise you might get too cold.
reviews.title: Home away from home plus the perqs of a hotel

reviews.text: We walked everywhere. To the Bund was 30 mins, Yuyuan Garden 20 mins. But if you don't like to walk in 30C heat, getting taxi from the hotel is easy (hotel staff can help you with this).
reviews.title: Convenient location, comfortable interiors but lousy frontdesk service

reviews.text: Gym: open 24-hours and has cardio equipments and weights. However, 2 out of 3 treadmills were out of order during our stay.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay in a Great Location!

description: Recently redesigned and refurbished, and in Fraser Residence Shanghai has also installed an air purifying and water filter system to ensure that every guest will enjoy a better quality of air and water in their luxurious apartments. Situated on the Puxi side of the Huangpo River, Fraser Residence Shanghai is just a block from Huaihai Road, Shanghai's bustling hub for business, shopping and entertainment. Xintiandi, with its iconic boutiques, bars and restaurants in historic Shikumen houses is nearby, as is the famous Dongtai Antique Market. Fraser Residence Shanghai features 324 Gold-Standard, contemporary apartments and excellent facilities. Minimalist in style, with airy rooms, subtle colours, Fraser Residence Shanghai is a relaxing, tranquil sanctuary in a vibrant, busy location. Guests will appreciate the greatly enhanced meeting facilities, high speed Wi-Fi throughout, tempting new F&B options, wellness spa, gym and indoor heated pool".
